musicalLanguage.description: The romantic piano theme from La La Land, played by Ryan Gosling's character in the film. The melody is built on cascading arpeggiated figures in A major that capture the magic and heartbreak of the story. The left hand plays jazz-influenced chord voicings while the right hand dances through the signature descending and ascending patterns that make this theme so memorable.
musicalLanguage.structure: A section: the cascading arpeggio theme (4 bars), B section: lyrical development and resolution (4 bars)
keyMoments: Bar 1: The opening A major arpeggio cascade — pure romantic magic.
Bars 3-4: The theme develops with wider intervals — reaching and yearning.
Bars 7-8: The gentle landing — bittersweet resolution.
teachingGoals: Pedaling technique for connected, resonant sound
styleTips: The right hand should flow like water — never choppy or mechanical
Use sustain pedal to create a wash of sound, changing with each chord
Think of Ryan Gosling playing this at the piano — passionate but effortless

measures.rightHand: E5:e C#5:e A4:e E5:e C#5:e A4:e E4:q
measures.teachingNote: A major — the cascading arpeggio. Let it flow downward like falling stars.

measures.rightHand: D5:e B4:e G#4:e D5:e B4:e G#4:e E4:q
measures.teachingNote: E major — same pattern, shifted. The cascade continues.

measures.rightHand: C#5:e A4:e F#4:e C#5:q A4:q F#4:q
measures.teachingNote: F#m — the pattern slows slightly. The melody breathes.
D major — stepwise descent. The theme finds its lyrical shape.
A major — ascending now. The melody reaches upward with hope.
F#m — peak and descent. Romantic yearning at its height.
D major — gentle rocking figure. Preparing the final landing.
A major — whole note A. The romance rests. Bittersweet and beautiful.
